intro: Cuphea sordida, commonly known as the dirty cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves with a slightly rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cuphea sordida is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display.
